titleInfo.title: Edward N. Marsh Civil War letter, 1862 Dec. 18

subject.topic: United States Army. Massachusetts Infantry Regiment, 52nd (1862-1863)

mods.abstract: Edward N. Marsh was a private in the 52nd Massachusetts Infantry. The 52nd arrived in Baton Rouge to occupy the city on December 17, 1862. In a letter to his brother and sister, written on a sheet of paper from a ledger he “liberated” from a Baton Rougean’s home, Private Marsh describes the scene in Baton Rouge, including his unit's landing, soldiers' taking items from homes, the town's deserted appearance, and the conditions of "contrabands," slaves who fled to the Federal encampments in Baton Rouge.

titleInfo.title: Edward N. Marsh Civil War Letter, Mss. 4891

copyInformation.subLocation: LSU Special Collections: Louisiana and Lower Mississippi Valley Manuscript Collection

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
